page.title: 14Bourne Engineering
page.content: This company was founded by Mr. Bourne in 1975, after the firm where he worked at that time had gone out of business. Mr. Bourne employs 14 male workers with an average age of 35. They work between 8 a.m. and 5 p.m. The firm manufactures expensive drawing equipment made from steel, some of which is obtained locally, some from Yorkshire. The steelwork is painted with high charged epoxy resin which costs Â£3.00 per kilogram. The resin is sprayed on to the frame which attracts it. It is then baked in an oven for half an hour until the paint hardens, then left to cool. The finished product is sold mainly in London. The rates bill for the company is Â£1500 a year and the phone and the electricity bills Â£1000 each.
